info.name: Dataprius API v2
info.description: Dataprius offers a different way to work with files in the Cloud. It is designed for companies. It allows you to work with company files without synchronizing, without conflicts, with multiple Users connected at the same time. Dataprius web site: [[English]](https://dataprius.com/en/home.html) [[Spanish]](https://dataprius.com) Contact Support: [https://dataprius.com/en/contact.html](https://dataprius.com/en/contact.html) ## Introduction Dataprius's API is organized around REST. It uses built-in HTTP features, like HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, which are understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients. JSON is returned in all API responses, including errors. ## Getting started You will need a Dataprius account and API keys. If you do not have a Dataprius account, go to the website, download and install the free version. You can download from the web in english or spanish. - [Dataprius downloads in english](https://dataprius.com/en/downloads) - [Dataprius downloads in spanish](https://dataprius.com/descargas) Once the application is installed. Go to the button in the lower left corner. - Click Start -> Configuration -> API Keys There you can request API keys. There is a activation process. Dataprius will send you an email when your request have been validated, then your keys will be available. After that, you can see API Keys on the same window in Configuration.

request.description:
Create a subfolder inside the folder passed as parameter.
Throws an error if a folder with same name already exists. Forbidden chars in Windows are not allowed.

Forbidden chars

    < (less than)
    > (greater than)
    : (colon)
    " (double quote)
    / (forward slash)
    \ (backslash)
    | (vertical bar or pipe)
    ? (question mark)
    * (asterisk)

response.name: Folder already exists
Too many requests from this IP, please try again in a few minutes.

item.description:
Folders management.

Manage and organize your company's folder structure in the cloud. This section allows you to create, rename, delete, and retrieve folders. Ensure a structured and secure environment for your organization's documents.

item.name: files

request.description:
Upload a file into a folder.

If the file already exists, it will be overwritten. An autocopy (backup copy of the previous version) will be generated at a minimum interval of 30 minutes.

Maximum file size is 2 gigabytes.

response.name: Maximum file size exceeded. Maximum 2 gigabytes.
Too many requests from this IP, please try again in a few minutes.

request.description: Get file information.

response.name: File does not exists
Too many requests from this IP, please try again in a few minutes.

request.description:
Download file.

Example:
```json
curl -X GET https://api.v2.dataprius.com/files/download/5ejdGqK \
    -H "Accept: application/octet-stream, application/json" \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer xxxxxxx" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/octet-stream" \
    -H "Content-Disposition: attachment;" \
    --output "c:\Users\John\Downloads\Dossier.docx"
```

Too many requests from this IP, please try again in a few minutes.

item.description:
File Operations

Handle file-related operations within your cloud storage. This section provides endpoints to upload, download, rename, and delete files.

item.name: search

request.description:
Search folders and files by name or by file Tags.
Search in all the Dataprius account or from a folder and its subfolders.
Max results: 500.
Search in the application: [https://manual.dataprius.com/en/search-for-files-and-folders/](url)

item.description:
**User Management.**

Manage web user accounts (your clients or external users) within the system. This section enables administrators to create, update, and delete web user profiles.

request.description: This is an Oauth2 basic authentication. To get an access token you will need the accounts Api keys. These are "clientId" and "clientSecret" credentials. You can get them from your Dataprius account configuration. If you do not have a Dataprius account, go to the website, download and install the Free Version . Once the application is installed. Go to the button in the lower left corner. Click Start -> Configuration -> API Keys There you can request API keys. There is a activation process. After that, you will see API Keys on the same window in Configuration. The Basic Authorization As is standard in basic access authentication, the headers structure corresponds to Authorization Basic credentials, where credentials is the result of: Joining clientId and clientSecret by a single colon (:) Applying Base64 (URL safe mode) to the result. Basic Credentials is the result of base64(clientId + ":" + clientSecret)

response.name: Too many requests from this IP, please try again in a few minutes.
